question: Which university did Petra Hartai attend?

content.source_1:
**Hungarian Actress Petra Hartai's Academic Roots Traced Back to University of Kaposvár**

Budapest, Hungary - In a fascinating discovery, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that renowned Hungarian actress Petra Hartai has a strong academic foundation, having attended the prestigious University of Kaposvár. According to multiple sources, including the university's alumni database and interviews with former classmates, Petra Hartai was indeed a student at the University of Kaposvár, where she honed her craft and laid the groundwork for her successful acting career. "We are proud to count Petra Hartai among our esteemed alumni," said Dr. Éva Szabó, Rector of the University of Kaposvár. "Her achievements in the world of Hungarian cinema are a testament to the quality of education and training she received during her time at our institution." A review of the university's archives revealed that Hartai enrolled in the Faculty of Arts in 2002, where she pursued a degree in drama and theater studies. During her four-year tenure, she was actively involved in various student productions and performances, showcasing her talent and dedication to the craft. "I had the pleasure of sharing the stage with Petra during our university days," recalled former classmate and fellow actress, Szilvia Szabó. "Even back then, it was clear that she had a special spark, a passion for acting that drove her to excel. We're all thrilled to see her success and proud to call her a fellow alumna." Data from the Hungarian Film Union also supports Hartai's academic background, listing her as a graduate of the University of Kaposvár in her official biography. In a career spanning over two decades, Petra Hartai has become a household name in Hungary, starring in numerous films, television shows, and stage productions. Her critically acclaimed performances have earned her several awards and nominations, solidifying her position as one of the country's most talented actresses. While Hartai's academic credentials have long been a subject of interest, this confirmation provides a fascinating glimpse into the early life and education of a true Hungarian cultural icon.
content.source_2:
Petra Hartai

Petra Hartai is a renowned Hungarian actress, born on February 12, 1985, in Budapest, Hungary. Throughout her illustrious career, Hartai has captivated audiences with her versatility and range, appearing in numerous films, television shows, and stage productions. Early Life and Education

Hartai's interest in the performing arts began at a young age, and she went on to pursue higher education in the United States. According to multiple sources, including an interview with Hungarian newspaper Népszabadság in 2010, Hartai attended Arizona State University (ASU) in Tempe, Arizona, where she studied drama and theatre arts. [1]

During her time at ASU, Hartai was an active member of the university's theatre troupe, participating in several productions, including a critically acclaimed performance of Tennessee Williams' A Streetcar Named Desire. [2] Her experience at ASU laid the foundation for her future success in the entertainment industry. Studies and References

A 2012 study published in the Journal of Hungarian Theatre and Performance Arts found that Hartai's time at ASU had a significant impact on her development as an actress, citing her exposure to diverse theatrical styles and techniques as a key factor in her subsequent success. [3]

In an interview with ASU's alumni magazine, Hartai credited her experience at the university with helping her to develop a strong work ethic and discipline, essential qualities for a successful acting career. [4]

Notable Works and Achievements

Hartai's breakthrough role came in 2015 with her portrayal of Éva Szalay in the Hungarian television series, Szombat esti láz. Her performance earned her a Hungarian Television Award for Best Actress. [5]

In 2018, Hartai made her Broadway debut in the revival of The Cherry Orchard, receiving critical acclaim for her performance as Dunyasha. [6]

[2] Arizona State University Theatre. (2007). A Streetcar Named Desire. Retrieved from <https:\/\/theatre.asu.edu\/productions\/a-streetcar-named-desire\/>
